title: Write in Expanded Form
text: We start by writing out the expression in its expanded form: $$-\left(2^4\right)=-\left(2\times2\times2\times2\right)$$, and we will simplify $$-\left(2\times2\times2\times2\right)$$ by performing multiplication four times.

title: Order of Operations
text: By the order of operations, we simplify what's in the parenthesis first.

title: First Multiplication
text: We now multiply the first $$2\times2$$ pair together and substitute the value back into the expression. What is $$2\times2$$?

title: First Multiplication
text: $$2\times2=4$$, and since $$2$$ and $$2$$ have the same signs, our final answer is positive: $$2\times2=4$$.

title: Current Expression
text: Substituting $$4$$ back, the orignal expression now becomes $$-\left(4\times2\times2\right)$$.

title: Second Multiplication
text: $$4\times2=8$$, and since $$4$$ and $$2$$ have the same signs, our final answer is positive: $$4\times2=8$$.

title: Current Expression
text: Substituting $$8$$ back, the orignal expression now becomes $$-\left(8\times2\right)$$.

title: Third Multiplication
text: $$8\times2=16$$, and since $$8$$ and $$2$$ have the same signs, our final answer is positive: $$8\times2=16$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Substituting $$16$$ back in, we get our final answer $$-16$$.
